class GLWindow

Detailed Description

A class for drawing randomly-generated 'checkers' of arbitrary width and height to the GLWindow.

For a full description of this plugin's parameters, it is recommended you see the Plugin Parameter Documentation for more details.

bool CheckerFlicker::init (  )  [protected, virtual]

Called as a result of start() when plugin is started.

You should reimplement this in your plugin to add initialization code for class variables, etc. It's important to properly initialize all variables that affect your drawFrame() function so that subsequent runs of the same plugin are identical and not polluted by crufty old state variables. Default implementation does nothing. Return false if you want to indicate init failure for some reason.

Reimplemented from StimPlugin.

void CheckerFlicker::cleanup (  )  [protected, virtual]

Called as a result of stop() when plugin is stopped.

Reimplement to clean up any permanent state that you fear might interfere with other plugins. In general this would only be the OpenGL state that needs to be undone (glEnable/glDisable, etc). Default implementation does nothing.

Reimplemented from StimPlugin.

void CheckerFlicker::save (  )  [protected, virtual]

default implementation does nothing, reimplement -- called for you on plugin exit if user elected to save data. In this method you should write to the StimPlugin::outStream member.
